intro: Lasianthera capitulata, commonly known as the yellow globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, typically in clustered inflorescences. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a fuzzy texture. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
